title: Acute severe asthma
description: a life-threatening condition characterized by a sudden worsening of asthma symptoms, including severe shortness of breath, wheezing, and difficulty breathing, often requiring emergency treatment.

title: Acute exacerbations of COPD
description: A common medical emergency especially in winter. May be triggered by viral or bacterial infections.

title: Pneumonia
description: An acute lower respiratory tract infection associated with fever, symptoms and signs in the chest, and abnormalities on the chest x-ray

title: Bronchiectasis
description: Chronic inﬂammation of the bronchi and bronchioles leading to permanent dilatation and thinning of these airways.

title: Pulmonary embolism (PE)
description: Venous thrombi, usually from DVT, pass into the pulmonary circulation and block blood fl ow to lungs. The source is often occult.

title: Pneumothorax
description: Mentions key items in pneumothorax management.

title: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
description: A common progressive disorder characterized by airway obstruction (FEV1 <80% predicted; FEV1/FVC <0.7; see p162 and table 4.5) with little or no reversibility. It includes chronic bronchitis and emphysema.

title: Pleural effusion
description: A peural effusion results from the accumulation of abnormal volumes (>10–​20 mL) of fluid in the pleural space.

title: Thoracentesis
description: Thoracentesis (pleural tap or pleural fluid aspiration) may be diagnostic or therapeutic.

title: Chronic Asthma
description: Mentions key items in Chronic asthma management.
